reviewText: So sad that they canceled the series, but getting it and the first season in a single box each was good stuff
Title: Iron Man: Armored Adventures, Complete Season 2

reviewText: I have liked this series ever since seeing it several years ago.  Seeing Iron Man portrayed as a teenager (very Spider-man like) is a good idea.  And, now that they have offered this entire season as one reasonably priced package I have to say that I highly recommend this and Season 1.
summary: Very Good Version of Iron Man
Title: Iron Man: Armored Adventures, Complete Season 2

reviewText: Though short lived this series was a nice reboot to the Ironman story.  Basically Tony Stark is now a teenager using his Ironman technology to gain back control of Stark Industries.  I won't say much more so as not to spoil any plot lines but suffice it to say a few arch enemies are also now the children of some evil person.Nice touch as it probably relates to the kids better.  Definitely makes for an interesting Ironman based story line.Animation is a bit "computer generated" looking, switching from excessively detailed shots to some that are more akin to a modern video game.  This seems to be a common theme with many cartoons/anime lately, not bad but annoying to some.
Title: Iron Man: Armored Adventures, Complete Season 2

reviewText: Season Two of Iron Man - Armored Adventures continues a few months after the end of the first. Tony Stark changes a lot by character but still leaves room for his wit and charm.  I would give away too much regarding appearances from select charactersand a few `What If' moments but very worthy of Iron Man atmosphere.  This will stay in my DVD collection and easily a `marathon'selection.
Title: Iron Man: Armored Adventures, Complete Season 2

reviewText: It's a good series I like the computer animation good stories and I love the guest appearances from the Avengers movie.  The only thing I don't care for is that they made ironman war machine and pepper young, other than that its very good.
Title: Iron Man: Armored Adventures, Complete Season 2

reviewText: In my opinion, over the past 10 years most action-oriented animated series can't seem to last ay most 2 seasons. To name a few: Fantastic Four: World's Greatest Heroes, Spectacular Spider-Man, Thundercats (2011 Series), Young Justice, Green Lantern, Wolverine and the X-Men, Avengers: Earth's Mightiest Heroes. He-Man and the Masters of the Universe (2002-03 Series), and the Super Hero Squad Show.I thought Iron Man: Armored Adventures was a great series, especially when I was initially reluctant to watch yet another show whose lead character had been made younger as part of the plot. Nevertheless, this made for great stories and for great appearances by other Marvel characters including Hawkeye, Black Widow, Black Panther, Dr.Doom, and the Hulk. I yearn for the time when an action-oriented animated series will last for more than 2 seasons again.
summary: Another good Marvel animated series falling victim to the "Two Season Curse"
Title: Iron Man: Armored Adventures, Complete Season 2
